addComplexType(  $name, \typeClass $typeClass = 'complexType', \phpType: $phpType = 'array', \compositor $compositor = '', \restrictionBase $restrictionBase = '', \elements $elements = array(), \attrs $attrs = array(), \arrayType: $arrayType = '' ) : void
inherited

adds a complex type to the schema

Inherited from: \nusoap_xmlschema::addComplexType()

example: array

addType( 'ArrayOfstring', 'complexType', 'array', '', 'SOAP-ENC:Array', array('ref'=>'SOAP-ENC:arrayType','wsdl:arrayType'=>'string[]'), 'xsd:string' );

example: PHP associative array ( SOAP Struct )

addType( 'SOAPStruct', 'complexType', 'struct', 'all', array('myVar'=> array('name'=>'myVar','type'=>'string') );

Parameters
Name Type Description
$name

name
$typeClass \typeClass

(complexType|simpleType|attribute)
$phpType \phpType:

currently supported are array and struct (php assoc array)
$compositor \compositor

(all|sequence|choice)
$restrictionBase \restrictionBase

namespace:name (http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/:Array)
$elements \elements

= array ( name = array(name=>'',type=>'') )
$attrs \attrs

= array( array( 'ref' => "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/:arrayType", "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/:arrayType" => "string[]" ) )
$arrayType \arrayType:

namespace:name (http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema:string)
Details
Access
public  
See
\getTypeDef

getTypeDef( string $type ) : mixed
inherited

returns an associative array of information about a given type returns false if no type exists by the given name

Inherited from: \nusoap_xmlschema::getTypeDef()

For a complexType typeDef = array( 'restrictionBase' => '', 'phpType' => '', 'compositor' => '(sequence|all)', 'elements' => array(), // refs to elements array 'attrs' => array() // refs to attributes array ... and so on (see addComplexType) )

For simpleType or element, the array has different keys.

Parameters
Name Type Description
$type string
Returns
Type Description
mixed

public  

\nusoap_client
jump to top

Package: Default

[nu]soapclient higher level class for easy usage.

usage:

// instantiate client with server info $soapclient = new nusoap_client( string path [ ,mixed wsdl] );

// call method, get results echo $soapclient->call( string methodname [ ,array parameters] );

// bye bye client unset($soapclient);

Parent(s)
\nusoap_base
Children
\soapclient
\soapclient
\nusoap_client_mime
Access

public  
call( string $operation, mixed $params = array(), string $namespace = 'http://tempuri.org', string $soapAction = '', mixed $headers = false, boolean $rpcParams = null, string $style = 'rpc', string $use = 'encoded' ) : mixed

calls method, returns PHP native type

Parameters
Name Type Description
$operation string

SOAP server URL or path
$params mixed

An array, associative or simple, of the parameters for the method call, or a string that is the XML for the call. For rpc style, this call will wrap the XML in a tag named after the method, as well as the SOAP Envelope and Body. For document style, this will only wrap with the Envelope and Body. IMPORTANT: when using an array with document style, in which case there is really one parameter, the root of the fragment used in the call, which encloses what programmers normally think of parameters. A parameter array must include the wrapper.
$namespace string

optional method namespace (WSDL can override)
$soapAction string

optional SOAPAction value (WSDL can override)
$headers mixed

optional string of XML with SOAP header content, or array of soapval objects for SOAP headers, or associative array
$rpcParams boolean

optional (no longer used)
$style string

optional (rpc|document) the style to use when serializing parameters (WSDL can override)
$use string

optional (encoded|literal) the use when serializing parameters (WSDL can override)
Returns
Type Description
mixed response from SOAP call, normally an associative array mirroring the structure of the XML response, false for certain fatal errors
Details
Access

\nusoap_server
jump to top

Package: Default

nusoap_server allows the user to create a SOAP server that is capable of receiving messages and returning responses

register( string $name, array $in = array(), array $out = array(), mixed $namespace = false, mixed $soapaction = false, mixed $style = false, mixed $use = false, string $documentation = '', string $encodingStyle = '' ) : void

Parameters
Name Type Description
$name string

the name of the PHP function, class.method or class..method
$in array

assoc array of input values: key = param name, value = param type
$out array

assoc array of output values: key = param name, value = param type
$namespace mixed

the element namespace for the method or false
$soapaction mixed

the soapaction for the method or false
$style mixed

optional (rpc|document) or false Note: when 'document' is specified, parameter and return wrappers are created for you automatically
$use mixed

optional (encoded|literal) or false
$documentation string

optional Description to include in WSDL
$encodingStyle string

optional (usually 'http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/' for encoded)

public  
addComplexType(  $name, \typeClass $typeClass = 'complexType', \phpType: $phpType = 'array', \compositor $compositor = '', \restrictionBase $restrictionBase = '', \elements $elements = array(), \attrs $attrs = array(), \arrayType: $arrayType = '' ) : void

adds a complex type to the schema

example: array

addType( 'ArrayOfstring', 'complexType', 'array', '', 'SOAP-ENC:Array', array('ref'=>'SOAP-ENC:arrayType','wsdl:arrayType'=>'string[]'), 'xsd:string' );

example: PHP associative array ( SOAP Struct )

addType( 'SOAPStruct', 'complexType', 'struct', 'all', array('myVar'=> array('name'=>'myVar','type'=>'string') );

Parameters
Name Type Description
$name

name
$typeClass \typeClass

(complexType|simpleType|attribute)
$phpType \phpType:

currently supported are array and struct (php assoc array)
$compositor \compositor

(all|sequence|choice)
$restrictionBase \restrictionBase

namespace:name (http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/:Array)
$elements \elements

= array ( name = array(name=>'',type=>'') )
$attrs \attrs

= array( array( 'ref' => "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/:arrayType", "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/:arrayType" => "string[]" ) )
$arrayType \arrayType:

namespace:name (http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema:string)
Details
Access
public  
See
\getTypeDef

getTypeDef( string $type ) : mixed

returns an associative array of information about a given type returns false if no type exists by the given name

For a complexType typeDef = array( 'restrictionBase' => '', 'phpType' => '', 'compositor' => '(sequence|all)', 'elements' => array(), // refs to elements array 'attrs' => array() // refs to attributes array ... and so on (see addComplexType) )

For simpleType or element, the array has different keys.

Parameters

$type string
Returns
Type Description
mixed

\soapclient
jump to top

Package: Default

For backwards compatiblity, define soapclient unless the PHP SOAP extension is loaded.

usage:

// instantiate client with server info $soapclient = new nusoap_client( string path [ ,mixed wsdl] );

// call method, get results echo $soapclient->call( string methodname [ ,array parameters] );

// bye bye client unset($soapclient);

Parent(s)
\nusoap_client < \nusoap_base
Author
Dietrich Ayala  
Author
Scott Nichol  
Version
$Id: class.soapclient.php 7541 2011-07-07 08:51:35Z gBrunier $

public  
call( string $operation, mixed $params = array(), string $namespace = 'http://tempuri.org', string $soapAction = '', mixed $headers = false, boolean $rpcParams = null, string $style = 'rpc', string $use = 'encoded' ) : mixed
inherited

calls method, returns PHP native type

Inherited from: \nusoap_client::call()
Parameters
Name Type Description
$operation string

SOAP server URL or path
$params mixed

An array, associative or simple, of the parameters for the method call, or a string that is the XML for the call. For rpc style, this call will wrap the XML in a tag named after the method, as well as the SOAP Envelope and Body. For document style, this will only wrap with the Envelope and Body. IMPORTANT: when using an array with document style, in which case there is really one parameter, the root of the fragment used in the call, which encloses what programmers normally think of parameters. A parameter array must include the wrapper.
$namespace string

optional method namespace (WSDL can override)
$soapAction string

optional SOAPAction value (WSDL can override)
$headers mixed

optional string of XML with SOAP header content, or array of soapval objects for SOAP headers, or associative array
$rpcParams boolean

optional (no longer used)
$style string

optional (rpc|document) the style to use when serializing parameters (WSDL can override)
$use string

optional (encoded|literal) the use when serializing parameters (WSDL can override)
Returns
Type Description
mixed response from SOAP call, normally an associative array mirroring the structure of the XML response, false for certain fatal errors
Details
Access

\soapval
jump to top

Package: Default

For creating serializable abstractions of native PHP types. This class allows element name/namespace, XSD type, and XML attributes to be associated with a value. This is extremely useful when WSDL is not used, but is also useful when WSDL is used with polymorphic types, including xsd:anyType and user-defined types.

Parent(s)
\nusoap_base
Access
public

Dietrich Ayala

addComplexType( string $name, string $typeClass = 'complexType', string $phpType = 'array', string $compositor = '', string $restrictionBase = '', array $elements = array(), array $attrs = array(), string $arrayType = '' ) : void

adds an XML Schema complex type to the WSDL types

Parameters
Name Type Description
$name string
$typeClass string

(complexType|simpleType|attribute)
$phpType string

currently supported are array and struct (php assoc array)
$compositor string

(all|sequence|choice)
$restrictionBase string

namespace:name (http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/:Array)
$elements array

e.g. array ( name => array(name=>'',type=>'') )
$attrs array

e.g. array(array('ref'=>'SOAP-ENC:arrayType','wsdl:arrayType'=>'xsd:string[]'))
$arrayType string

as namespace:name (xsd:string)
Details

addOperation( string $name, array $in = false, array $out = false, string $namespace = false, string $soapaction = false, string $style = 'rpc', string $use = 'encoded', string $documentation = '', string $encodingStyle = '' ) : void

register an operation with the server

Parameters
Name Type Description
$name string

operation (method) name
$in array

assoc array of input values: key = param name, value = param type
$out array

assoc array of output values: key = param name, value = param type
$namespace string

optional The namespace for the operation
$soapaction string

optional The soapaction for the operation
$style string

(rpc|document) optional The style for the operation Note: when 'document' is specified, parameter and return wrappers are created for you automatically
$use string

(encoded|literal) optional The use for the parameters (cannot mix right now)
$documentation string

optional The description to include in the WSDL
$encodingStyle string

optional (usually 'http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/' for encoded)
